activities.loc: JMB Check Monitor & Posted Calendar for Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Theresa Anna-Marie Smith

records.addlTxt: Adjusted down from $1000.00 cash bond to $2,500.00 signature bond.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473. 
Must not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license or permit. 
Must not possess, ingest, inhale or inject any controlled substances unless prescribed by a medical provider.


09/22/2022 COURT AMENDS BOND FROM $1000.00 CASH BOND TO $2,500.00 SIGNATURE BOND WITH ADDED CONDITIONS: "MAY NOT POSSESS OR CONSUME DRUGS OR ALCOHOL, MAY NOT GO ONTO ANY PREMESIS WHERE ALCOHOL IS SOLD, MAY NOT DRIVE WITHOUT A JUDGE'S PERMISSION, AND MUST APPEAR IN PERSON TO NEXT HEARING."  ALL OTHER CONDITIONS OF THIS BOND REMAIN IN FULL FORCE AND EFFECT.

3:45 PM Defendant Theresa Anna-Marie Smith in court, in custody. Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow in court for Theresa Anna-Marie Smith. Attorney Rockow relates regarding housing. 

Court relates and modifies bond to "$2500.00 signature bond, may not possess or consume drugs or alcohol, may not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold, and may not drive without a judge's permission.  Must appear in person to next hearing. All other conditions of bond remain in full force and effect."

1:00 PM Defendant Theresa Anna-Marie Smith appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Dustin Rockow appeared by video for Theresa Anna-Marie Smith.  Court Reporter appeared by Zoom video means. 
Attorney Rockow relates on modifying bond and where Defendant would be living if released. State relates and leaves the decision to the discretion of the court.  Defendant relates.  Court relates they need confirmation from the family member where Defendant will stay before they would agree to modifying bond.  Reset to 3:45 today.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

3:54 PM Defendant Theresa Anna-Marie Smith appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow in court for Theresa Anna-Marie Smith.  Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

3:54 PM Officer Anthony Brunner, patrol officer for Cumberland PD, called, sworn and questioned by State.
3:58 PM   No cross by Attorney Rockow

State relates and offers Exhibit 1-Certified Bond.  
Court receives Exhibit 1. 

Court finds probable cause and binds over.
Arraignment scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:44 AM Defendant Theresa Anna-Marie Smith appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow appeared by video for Theresa Anna-Marie Smith.  Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

10:44  Court relates and gives appearances.  Defendant qualifies for Public Defender services.
10:45  Atty. Rockow relates.  Defense moves for bond modification to $200 cash with same conditions.
10:46  State objects to bond modification.
10:46  Court relates and denies request for bond modification.
Defense requests preliminary hearing be set.
Preliminary hearing set before Judge Bitney.
Bond to continue.

(MS scanned to jail)
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

1:06 PM Defendant Theresa Anna-Marie Smith appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow appeared by video for Theresa Anna-Marie Smith.  Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does qualify for SPD representation.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
